text: <!channel>: good morning! I have a meeting at the twin's new preschool this morning, so I won't be able to make it to standup. Let's do a virtual version instead. Here's mine:
Animation: yesterday's test was helpfull, but we don't need to worry about this until after the dogfood delivery this week. We'll address as part of updates for production.
Copy: Requested
Images for Dogfood: For day and night, they'll be delivering stock images that will be updated for production (once they figure out animation)

User Flow after NFC customization: Think we're fine here, but I'll get direction on toast vs dialogue. There's a card in trello to make this take users back to the menu after they've selected and user has been given confirmation.
Code Updates: Waiting on additional feedback; Evans checked in updates yesterday
Cadence of Image Rotation: I think they're going to choose the version that takes # of images over the alloted time, rather than having it set by x (amt of time)

Trello: Let's please use this for any bugs or tweaks we're working on this week.  I know we did visual QA on paper yesterday, which is cool, but with additional one-offs, let's use trello. It's a good way to track, and to give the client some visibility.
jenny and i should be starting to hook the app together today, I'll also be styling the background CMS,  as well as doing some general styling and functional stuff.

Webview vs Native: Checked back on this, and we're going to wait to see if the move to native is something that's requested in the review process. Adam wants to make sure we stay focused on current bugs and build for Friday.
I'm going to keep plugging away at lint issues and took care of some visual QA issues yesterday
Going to start the help section. Do we feel we still want this?
<@U02F9CXTL>: Instructions in the CMS, like when someone clicks on the ?
yep
Cool. I think that would be good to have. Can you please start a trello column for it? :wink:
no porblem
problem -
Actually, I just added a card to the CMS column and added you to it
I can help with any content questions when you get in
Thanks!
Lint warnings under 200 - yay
woohoo!
